            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Matawa Water Futures (MWF) project was developed through the Global Water Futures project to advance Indigenous-informed water science to support decision-making and water stewardship in the Matawa First Nation (MFN) homelands and traditional territories in Northern Ontario. The objective for the end of the MWF project is to hold a large water-themed gathering, inviting all MFN communities to attend to celebrate the value and sacredness of water, as well as share observations and scientific knowledge about the water, and share progress in water and environmental stewardship programs. 
A vital piece that has supported this project over the years has been the relationships built within our communities, as well as those relationships built with other nations and organizations. In keeping with this appreciation of fostering and maintaining relationships, we would like to extend an invitation to include Indigenous groups and organizations around Canada and beyond who are working in water and environmental initiatives or programs, overall advancing Indigenous stewardship within their own homelands. 
This gathering is an opportunity to: Share knowledge and learn from each other about water relationships, values and perspectives, as well as water & environmental stewardship practices and policies; and to Facilitate opportunities for collaboration and relationship-building.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

name: 10-25976-4836-yl97
notes:
The Matawa Water Futures (MWF) project was developed through the Global Water Futures project to advance Indigenous-informed water science to support decision-making and water stewardship in the Matawa First Nation (MFN) homelands and traditional territories in Northern Ontario. The objective for the end of the MWF project is to hold a large water-themed gathering, inviting all MFN communities to attend to celebrate the value and sacredness of water, as well as share observations and scientific knowledge about the water, and share progress in water and environmental stewardship programs. 
A vital piece that has supported this project over the years has been the relationships built within our communities, as well as those relationships built with other nations and organizations. In keeping with this appreciation of fostering and maintaining relationships, we would like to extend an invitation to include Indigenous groups and organizations around Canada and beyond who are working in water and environmental initiatives or programs, overall advancing Indigenous stewardship within their own homelands. 
This gathering is an opportunity to: Share knowledge and learn from each other about water relationships, values and perspectives, as well as water & environmental stewardship practices and policies; and to Facilitate opportunities for collaboration and relationship-building.

notes_translated.en:
The Matawa Water Futures (MWF) project was developed through the Global Water Futures project to advance Indigenous-informed water science to support decision-making and water stewardship in the Matawa First Nation (MFN) homelands and traditional territories in Northern Ontario. The objective for the end of the MWF project is to hold a large water-themed gathering, inviting all MFN communities to attend to celebrate the value and sacredness of water, as well as share observations and scientific knowledge about the water, and share progress in water and environmental stewardship programs. 
A vital piece that has supported this project over the years has been the relationships built within our communities, as well as those relationships built with other nations and organizations. In keeping with this appreciation of fostering and maintaining relationships, we would like to extend an invitation to include Indigenous groups and organizations around Canada and beyond who are working in water and environmental initiatives or programs, overall advancing Indigenous stewardship within their own homelands. 
This gathering is an opportunity to: Share knowledge and learn from each other about water relationships, values and perspectives, as well as water & environmental stewardship practices and policies; and to Facilitate opportunities for collaboration and relationship-building.
notes_translated.fr:
Le projet Matawa Water Futures (MWF) a été développé dans le cadre du projet Global Water Futures afin de faire progresser la science de l'eau informée par les Autochtones afin de soutenir la prise de décisions et la gestion de l'eau sur les terres ancestrales et les territoires traditionnels de la Première nation de Matawa (MFN) dans le nord de l'Ontario. L'objectif de la fin du projet MWF est d'organiser un grand rassemblement sur le thème de l'eau, invitant toutes les communautés de la NPF à y assister pour célébrer la valeur et le caractère sacré de l'eau, partager des observations et des connaissances scientifiques sur l'eau, et partager les progrès réalisés dans les programmes de gestion de l'eau et de l'environnement. 
Un élément essentiel qui a soutenu ce projet au fil des ans a été les relations établies au sein de nos communautés, ainsi que les relations établies avec d'autres nations et organisations. Dans le cadre de cette reconnaissance de la nécessité de favoriser et de maintenir des relations, nous aimerions inviter les groupes et organisations autochtones du Canada et d'ailleurs qui travaillent dans le cadre d'initiatives ou de programmes relatifs à l'eau et à l'environnement, dans l'ensemble, faisant progresser l'intendance autochtone sur leur propre territoire. 
Ce rassemblement est l'occasion de : partager des connaissances et apprendre les uns des autres sur les relations, les valeurs et les perspectives relatives à l'eau, ainsi que sur les pratiques et politiques de gestion de l'eau et de l'environnement ; et de faciliter les opportunités de collaboration et d'établissement de relations.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
